question: The "Kagnew Battalion" was a military unit under the command of the United Nations that originated in which country?
explanation: Kagnew Battalion was a infantry-battalion military unit originated from the imperial army of Ethiopia, under the command of the United Nations, which was active from 1951 to 1965, mainly deployed in the Korea War (1950-1953). It was mainly a part of the US 7th Infantry Division. The performance of this battalion was so great that attracted distinctive recognition.
